page.title: MTV Video Music Award for Best Pop Video

rev.comment: This image use does not comply with [[WP:NFCC]] #10c and MUST be removed until it does. Thank you. See [[WP:FIXNF]] and [[WP:10CR]]
rev.diff:
Line 2: Line 2:
The '''MTV Video Music Award for Best Pop Video''' was first given out in {{Mtvvma|1999}}, as MTV began to put several [[teen pop]] acts in heavy rotation. Nominations, however, were not just limited to pop acts, as dance, R&B, pop/rock, and, most recently, reggaeton artists have also received '''Best Pop Video''' nominations throughout the award's history. In {{Mtvvma|2007}}, MTV eliminated this award along with all of the genre categories, but it returned in 2008. [[Britney Spears]] has received the most wins and nominations in this category, winning three awards out of seven nominations.
The '''MTV Video Music Award for Best Pop Video''' was first given out in {{Mtvvma|1999}}, as MTV began to put several [[teen pop]] acts in heavy rotation. Nominations, however, were not just limited to pop acts, as dance, R&B, pop/rock, and, most recently, reggaeton artists have also received '''Best Pop Video''' nominations throughout the award's history. In {{Mtvvma|2007}}, MTV eliminated this award along with all of the genre categories, but it returned in 2008. [[Britney Spears]] has received the most wins and nominations in this category, winning three awards out of seven nominations.
[[Image:Ricky Martin at the National Puerto Rican Day Parade.jpg|right|upright|thumb|alt=|the first winner [[Ricky Martin]] in 1999.]]
[[Image:Ricky Martin at the National Puerto Rican Day Parade.jpg|right|upright|thumb|alt=|the first winner [[Ricky Martin]] in 1999.]]
